Class TaskSet

java.lang.Object
java.util.AbstractCollection<Task>
java.util.AbstractList<Task>
java.util.Vector<Task>
WorkLoadSet.TaskSet
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, Iterable<Task>, Collection<Task>, List<Task>, RandomAccess, SequencedCollection<Task>
public class TaskSet extends Vector<Task>
Collection of tasks participating in the workload. Extends Vector to store Task instances and provides aggregate statistics (utilization, critical section ratios) and performance metrics (average pending/response/blocking times) across all tasks.

maxProcessingSpeed is expressed in MHz (單位=MHz). Scheduling horizon calculation integrates least common multiple (LCM) of periods and may fall back to a scaled constant (200 * magnificationFactor) when tasks have non-zero arrival offsets. Nest set construction (see setNestSetForTask()) groups critical sections into nested structures based on start/end inclusion forming hierarchical resource usage patterns.

Author:
ShiuJia
See Also:

    • getScheduleTimeForTaskSet

      public long getScheduleTimeForTaskSet()
      Compute scheduling horizon for the task set.

      Returns LCM of all task periods when all arrival times are zero; otherwise returns a fallback constant (200 * magnificationFactor).

      Returns:
      schedule horizon time units

    • setNestSetForTask

      public void setNestSetForTask()
      Build nested critical section relationships for each task.

      Iterates critical sections in order, assigning inner/outer relationships when start/end bounds are fully included. Creates a Nest per top-level chain and attaches critical sections accordingly. Prints diagnostic information mapping tasks to resource nesting.
